alert.note: Alert for Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 3:41PM EST until December 20 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Merrimack River At Haverhill affecting Essex County. For the Merrimack River...including Haverhill...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merrimack River at Haverhill. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding is expected in low lying sections around Haverhill. Marinas near and downstream of Haverhill should take action to protect boats and docks due to the increased flows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 13.4 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.6 feet on 06/18/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1000 AM EST.
